episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including tornado chasers in America, a chocolate quarantine center in the UK, a Soviet-era architectural project that aimed to project news onto clouds, and the peculiar behavior of caterpillars when they are alone. The hosts delve into these facts with humor and curiosity, exploring the unusual and often surprising details behind each one.

facts.fact: In America, you get traffic jams caused by people chasing tornadoes.
There is a special quarantine centre for chocolate in the English countryside.
To celebrate the Communist Revolution, the Bolsheviks planned to build a tower in St. Petersburg that projected the news onto the clouds.
Caterpillars are more likely to vomit when they're on their own.
